Reviews.Title: “My Roman home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Seraphial
Reviews.Content: For my 5 night stay in Rome I did a lot of research into the various hostels and hotels available around the Trevi Fountain/Spanish Steps area, and the Boccaccio consistently rated high on a lot of website reviews. So I bit the bullet and I'm glad I did. First off, it's extremely easy to find, just a block or so down from Station Barberini, which is only 2 stops from Termini. When you get there you realise just how close it is to the sites in this part of Rome - the Trevi is extremely close by and the Spanish Steps only a few blocks away. When you get there you go up one flight of stairs (a lift is available) and are greeted by a smiling Patty at the door. Patty is the 3rd generation owner of the Boccaccio and a lovely, maternal presence in the house. If nots really a hostel, nor pension or hotel. It really is an extension of Patty's home, and guests are encouraged to treat it that way. So no fancy locks, TVs, air con, etc. There's a few flyers by the door, but Patty has a wealth of knowledge to share if you need insight into Rome. I stayed in the single room overlooking the front door. I've heard other reviews mention the noise but I was fine. It's bright, sunny, big for a single, comfortable and sported a sink and cupboard. It was also very clean, and the cleaner does come around every day to tidy up. There's a separate bathroom and another shower/toilet room down the hall which is also maintained well. I suppose where one's expectations need to be adjusted is that this really is Patty's home, and if you're comfortable in that kinda space it's lovely. What separates it from hostels is the level of service, even if the amenities are similar to what you can get elsewhere. I'd definitely recommend it for travellers who want a personable experience in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaPG
Reviews.Content: As we were first time in Rome it was more then easy to find the hotel, it took us 3 min from Barberini metro station. Hotel is in the old building (like each building in Rome), on the first floor. The owner Patty was very kind to wait for us to check-in as we came an hour later then expected. We got the keys from the building entrance doors, so we could come and go whenever suitable for us. All roman attractions are practicly nearby, Fontana di Trevi is on 5 min walking, also Piazza di Spagna, Piazza della Reppublica, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Pallazzo Venezia etc. Metro and bus station are near, but we haven`t use them a lot as Rome is great for walking. Anyway we recommend this hotel for couples and friends and everyone that will use it only for shower and sleep. Our room was very clean, we had a private bathroom, also very clean, so everything as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, character hotel”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel easily, and it is very well located for sightseeing in Rome. There are plenty of restaurants and bars nearby too. It is a quirky hotel with lots of character, and the owner Patty is friendly and helpful. Our double ensuite room was spacious, and although simply furnished it was warm and cosy throughout the freezing temperatures of our February stay. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. The bathroom is modern, and all was maintained to a high standard of cleanliness. The only improvement we could suggest would be some larger and fluffier towels! We really enjoyed our stay here, and would certainly stay there again next time we are in Rome - it was excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cute but uncomfortable.”
Reviews.Author: M A
Reviews.Content: The hotel had no AC, which in summer in Rome, is quite awful. This would have been fine, as we knew that when we booked it, but we also could not open the window due to the fact that the hotel is on the first floor be over a popular bar. We heard people talking ALL night, as it is also a busy area in the morning, and smelled smoke from the cigarettes in our room. Otherwise, the hotel was very cute, and everything was clean. However, for the loud location above a bar, and the shared bathroom facilities, this hotel is not such a great deal, as it is not inexpensive enough to make up for these qualities. After the first night we moved hotels down the street, paying 30 more euro for one night and the exact same price the other night for MUCH better accommodations- including AC, private bathroom, and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel/homestay”
Reviews.Author: KrisztaHelsinki
Reviews.Content: A bit difficult to find the hotel (homestay) after darkness. Building is shared with other homestays and hotel Petros (look for Petros, door bell on the left side for Boccaccio) Otherwise very good location, 10 min to Trevi, 15 min to Spagna. Owner is very nice and friendly. Asked for silent room and my room was perfectly silent and clean. First time good sleep away from home. Had even own bathroom, although common was noted in booking. Huge room, nice decor, comfortable bed. The best hotel room I have ever stayed! I recommend it even for families! It is a gem in the heart of Rome old town for resonable price. I wish all hotels would be like this. I travel a lot, but never had such good experience, I wish my best for the owner (Patty) to continue this way!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money. Clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: One-sR
Reviews.Content: While all the hotels in Rome were booked because of easter and the beautification of the pope, we found this little hotel. Location is excellent, just by the metro, spanish steps and trevi fountain. Patty was very friendly and helpfull. We shared the bathroom with some other rooms, but everything was very clean and we didn't have to wait long to take a shower in te morning. Don't expect a fancy hotel, but if you are looking for good value for money in a cosey hotel in the center of Rome, Boccaccio is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Boccaccio - A Great Little Find in the Historic Centre”
Reviews.Author: CinziaVancouver
Reviews.Content: This is a great little eco-friendly hotel. It’s centrally located and only a 5 minute walk to the Trevi Fountain. The Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Piazza Navona are all within walking distance. From Roma Termini take Metro Line A to Barbarini. (This is only 2 stops from Roma Termini) or you can walk and that takes only 15-20 minutes. Hotel Boccaccio is in the same building as the Hotel De Petris. When you enter the main floor area, you will see 2 lifts/elevators. The lift for Hotel Boccaccio is slightly to your right. The one that you will see directly in front of you is for Hotel De Petris. Just hop onto the lift and press “1” and when the elevator door opens Hotel Boccaccio will be right in front of you. I arrived around 11pm and Patrizia was graciously waiting for me. Patrizia is the owner and this hotel is also her home. Once inside Boccaccio, the guest rooms are in front and slightly to the left. I had emailed the day before advising that my plane would be in late and Patrizia promptly replied that she would be waiting for me. Upon arrival I was given the keys. A key is given for the hotel room, the hotel entrance on the 1st floor and the outside entrance to the building. So basically you have 24 hour access. I booked a single room with shared bathroom and shared shower. There was never a wait to use these facilities which was great. There are 2 bathrooms one with a shower and one without and they are side by side in the hallway. The room I had faced Via Del Boccaccio. There is a great ambiance of Italian restaurants at night on this street so shut your window if you don’t like the sound. My room included: Sink with mirror, towels, Eco friendly soaps & shower foam, bed lamp, large closet; desk with lamp, fan, lovely large window and double bed. Energy conserving light bulbs are used throughout the property. Also, because this is an eco-hotel, the towels are not changed everyday. I have taken a photo of their eco policy for further reading. There is free wifi available from 9:30 a.m. to 11:00 pm in the lobby. Just take your laptop and sit in the lovely seating area. FYI, because these are old historical buildings the wifi signal does not reach the bedrooms. In the main lobby there are lots of brochures for Rome sight seeing as well as a complimentary maps of Rome. There is no breakfast served at this hotel but there are lots of places to grab a cappuccino and something to eat. Also, there is a grocery store at the end of the street where you can grab fresh baked goods, fruit, water, juice, pre-made sandwiches etc. I had complete privacy during my 3 night stay and if I had any questions Patrizia was available to answer them. I enjoyed my stay in this hotel and would definitely stay here again. Patrizia is really nice and that adds to the great energy of the place. My room cost was $45.00 Euro per night taxes included and I stayed in this hotel September 4, 5 & 6, 2010.

Reviews.Title: “It's not a hotel, it's a home”
Reviews.Author: LeoCPH
Reviews.Content: I wasn't kidding with the title I wrote for my review. This place is more like home. There is no reception, no flashy sign, no electronic rome keys. It's literally like you stay with Patty during your visit in Rome. It might not be for everyone, but for me it's perfect. I have travelled around the world and I always tried to stay with friends for the visits even for business trip because for me, it's always great not feeling like a stranger in a foreign place. The hotel is a converted old apartment in Rome. The room is basic but clean. The shared bathroom and toilet are clean, more than I expected to be honest. Patty is a great host. She's really helpful. She will give you the keys to room and building so you can come and go whenever you want. The location is unbeatable. Close to the metro and bus stations. 5-10 minutes walk to Trevi and Spanish Step. There a lot of cafes and bakery store around the area. Overall, I'm glad I decided to stay there. And I will be back next time I visit Rome. Not that because I can't afford paying more somewhere else. But I just want to stay at 'home' again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tbaileyasm84
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the other reviews I'd read I was a little apprehensive about staying at this hotel, but it was actually great. There was 24 hour access, the room and bathroom (I had a single room with a shared shower and bathroom) were both quite clean. Because it is an Eco-friendly hotel they didn't change sheets or towels everyday to conserve energy/water, but I think they would change them (the towels at least) as often as you needed. I also thought it was nice that even though the bathroom was shared, I had a sink and mirror in my room so I could brush my teeth etc without having to share the bathroom. Wi-fi was only available during the daytime and not accessable from my room, but it was free. The location really couldn't be beat. Very close to the Trevi Fountain, a few blocks from the Barbarini metro (just 2 stops from Termini, the main train station). This did mean some street noise till quite late though.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Quirky Place”
Reviews.Author: NOnionsXPickles
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my boyfriend and his parents. The hotel is actually a large apartment, that the owner, Patty, converted into a hotel. It's a little strange, as the hallway is open to her living room area, and I felt a little awkward having to go into her 'home' to ask her questions and check out. But Patty was always very nice, though, and enjoys sharing her home with everyone. Definitely better than staying in an anonymous hotel! The rooms were fine, though no a/c, which we definitely could of used. I had no issues with the bathrooms, and like that there was one with a shower, and one with just a sink and toilet. Our room was a little small - but Patty gave us a good deal on it b/c of the size - and the parent's room was roomy. The hallways were noisy, and even though we had a room toward the back, we could always hear the floors creaking and doors opening and closing. The location is great, close to the Trevi Fountain. The hotel is on a little alley. While I never felt unsafe, I did feel a bit uncomfortable walking around there at night. There are lots of cafes/restaurants around, and the metro is just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “lovely place, great location”
Reviews.Author: tsms1
Reviews.Content: My daughter (15) and I (45) were in Italy for two weeks. We stayed four nights in Boccaccio Hotel, in a room with privet bathroom; Patty was wonderful, very kind and helpful. The room is very simple, nice, spacious, and very clean. It was so nice and felt like being at home. The location is great too, a short walking distance from major sites like the Spanish Steps and Fontana di Trevi. We would definitely recommend it to our friends, and would love to stay in it again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price”
Reviews.Author: kerrycat
Reviews.Content: This is less of a hotel and more of a house which rents rooms out. We had no problems here but the key system is a little odd because anyone can enter your room when you are not there!! The bathrooms smelt of bleach and seemed clean, there was hot water any time we needed it. The price is excellent for the location (just 3 mins walk to trevi fountain). the room was quiet hot adn there was no air-con, id hate to be there in the height of the summer, also we couldnt keep the window open because there was a lot of noise from outside(which was less when the window was closed). Overall the location was brilliant and I searched a lot of places and found nothing cheaper for this location so if you want location and don't really care about having a top notch hotel then this place is for you. if you care about the little things then don't book this!

Reviews.Title: “Very loud, no security, sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: chinakeli
Reviews.Content: It is a cute place, but difficult to find and to get to, on a slightly shady street. My biggest problem with this hotel would be its extremely loud location across the alley from an all-night restaurant. Despite industrial-strength hunting earplugs, I was woken up by loud laughter and shouting about once an hour until 5 a.m. Also, the key to the door never worked properly, it was an old-fashioned key that didn't fit, and as there was a large sign that the door was made of glass (?), it always took quite some time to close it. Staff did not speak English. Decor was nice, with lots of greenery.

Reviews.Title: “Sad and dirty”
Reviews.Author: Talisa2009
Reviews.Content: No service - difficult to get contact with the reception before 9:30 and a strange 'take your own key ' system that let everybody get hold of each others keys. Small stange room with a corridor built into it which meant other travellers walked by to get to their rooms. Very dirty and run down bath - wasn't cleaned during my stay. Central but extremly noisy location - the shutter on the windows doesnt work. Everything in the room very ugly and cheap, overall a sad atmosphere and not a place you would want to spend any time - also no common areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Chaaz
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Boccacio on June 21 for 2 nights. For 45Euro, single room, it was quite a steal! The hotel is on the 1st floor. Upon enetring the main door, you have to climb a few steps of stairs. (Not a bad thing, though, if you're not carrying a heavy luggage.) You either go in the elevator or ride a few steps up. Coming inside Hotel Boccacio is like settling into a homey place. The hotel inside is serene and tidy. I was led to my room, which overlooked the street that led to to Fontana di Trevi. My room had the basic essentials. I had a bed good enough for one person, two tables which I used for writing and putting on my cameras and stuffs. There was a sink with a bath and face towels and a small cabinet where I placed my toiletries. The bathroom and toilet are right outside the door. It was very clean and in good condition. The hotel owner, Patrizia, was very friendly and kind to book my transportation from the hotel to the airport. She even offered tips on where to go and where to eat. The hotel does not have free breakfast but there are cafes and restaurants near the area. A major plus is the walking distance to the Fontana di Trevi. I walked to the Trevi every night during my whole stay. In total, I recommend this hotel to fellow single traveller's like me. And I will definitely return to this hotel. Definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, but avoid the shared shower”
Reviews.Author: traveler343
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and had interesting, cozy decorations. However, our room did not have a shower and we used the shared shower down the hall. The shared shower had so much mold that it made me slightly dizzy and nautious. I would recommend the rooms with a shower, but not the rooms without a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: matthooper
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located on a quiet street, a secured building with a wonderfully pleasant owner. The hotel is just minutes away from the Trevi Fountain. The room itself is bare bones basic with actually a bit more size than most in it's class. However the bathroom was decrepit, old (but clean) towels added to the general uncomfortable feel to the bathroom. Our room was out in a small somewhat charming courtyard, free from all city noise. Overall, I wouldn't want to spend more than a night here. Even for a big city in Europe at just 100 euro a night, I expect a bit more.

Reviews.Title: ““Clean and cozy””
Reviews.Author: manjit69
Reviews.Content: “Clean and cozy” and a generally relaxed environment all-round. It was my first trip to Rome, and didn't spend much time in my room as I was always on the go. It is near the metro station Barberini, so it makes very easy to get around by bus and Metro. It is also within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. The owner was friendly and the place was incredibly clean. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “very nice pension”
Reviews.Author: foystravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel - my husband and I. We were very happy with the little hotel. Our room was small, but clean and we didnt have any troubles with noise. It was easy to come and go. We only had a sink in our room and shared shower/toilet with the other rooms. It felt more like a bed and breakfast with no breakfast than an hotel - but we loved it. THere is a pub around the corner owned by a lovely Scottish woman - The Arthur - that was fun and Hosteria Romana next door was a yummy restuarant that Patrizia suggested. Very close to the Trevi Fountain and a 10 min walk to Spanish Steps and Piazza Republica. We would def stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “A little jewel in the heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: noelkostantinos
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Rome regularly for both of our jobs and we have tried many two and three star hotels over the last number of years. My wife first told me of Hotel Boccaccio when it was recommended to her by a friend and each of us subsequently have stayed there numerous times in the past year. The location is perfect for both business and sight seeing as it is within five minutes walk from Trevi Fountain and Via del Corso. The atmosphere is extremely friendly and the rooms are always cosy and clean. Finally the price is very competitive, especially considering the location and my wife and I would thoroughly recommend Hotel Boccaccio to both business travellers and those seeking an authentic Roman experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fine-Would go again!”
Reviews.Author: BOLTS_1
Reviews.Content: Take into account the star rating of the hotel, and you will be very pleased. It had everything that was needed. A nice, clean, comfortable bed, a sink in the room, communal bathroom. The best part was where it was located. Perfect! A nice walk to all major locations. The Trevi fountain was not more then a 5 minute walk. If you are looking for a clean place to stay, that is very afordable, and close to everything, then this is the place to stay!!! DMV

Reviews.Title: “Not Great”
Reviews.Author: eurotripper05
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Boccaccio for 4 nights in late Feb. To call it a hotel is a little complimentary. It is a pensione in which a number of rooms are located off of a central hallway with the owner's living quaters at the end of the hall. The decor is unique to say the least, artistic perhaps. The rooms were large enough, esp for Rome but the bathrooms are not good. We were given the wrong room on the first two nights even though we had booked way in advance. The beds in both rooms were as hard as rocks, you might as well have slept on the floor. The bathrooms were very cramped and in the second bathroom there was mould growing on the walls due to poor ventilation. The towels and linen was never changed during our stay. The lady owner/manager was not particularly helpful and indeed on one occasion particularly obtuse. You are given a front door key but are told to leave your room key in the hall when you the "hotel." This made me particularly uncomfortable as you might as well have hung a sign on the door saying " we are not in the room, come in and make yourself comfortable." The owner also insisted on retaining our passports during the whole of our stay, despite our requests for them to be returned and her assurances that she would give them to us "the next day." I can see why people choose to stay here due to the prices of accommodation in Rome, but I cannot say that I recommend it. I would definetely stay elsewhere. Location is quite good and that is the only reason for the 2 circle rating.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Boccaccio
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Boccaccio, 25, 00187 Rome, Italy
